name:
WARNING: please check you have started this container with a volume that is mounted to /data
 otherwise any flow changes are lost when you redeploy or upgrade the container
 (e.g. upgrade to a more recent node-red docker image).
  If you are using named volumes you can ignore this warning.
 Double click or see info side panel to learn how to start Node-RED in Docker to save your work
info:
To start docker with a bind mount volume (-v option), for example:

```
docker run -it -p 1880:1880 -v /home/user/node_red_data:/data --name mynodered nodered/node-red
```

where `/home/user/node_red_data` is a directory on your host machine where you want to store your flows.

If you do not do this then you can experiment and redploy flows, but if you restart or upgrade the container the flows will be disconnected and lost. 

They will still exist in a hidden data volume, which can be recovered using standard docker techniques, but that is much more complex than just starting with a named volume as described above.

name: /help

description: Set all the settings of the sensor simulator

name: keyboard SetSimulation Step 0
Salva IdMessaggio nel ChatContex

SCancel 
 S0 
 S1 
 S2 
 S3 
 S4 
 S5 
 otherwise
Keyboard SetSimulation Step 1
Abort SetSimulation
Salva il numero di campi e presenta Keyboard Step 2 Sensori

SET SIMULATION 
 
 SCancel 
 The SCancel step is used to cancel the process of creating a new setting.
 
 S0
 The S0 step is used to ask the user if they wish to start a new setting.
 
 S1
 Step S1 is for specifying the number of farm fields, between 1 and 6.
 
 S2
 Step S2 allows the user to indicate which sensors are present in each agricultural field.
  This step is iterated until the S2 OK or S2 ALL command is received.
 
 S2 OK and S2 ALL
 Steps S2 OK and S2 ALL are used to confirm the selection of sensors for the current agricultural field.
 
 S3
 Step S3 is used to define the starting climatic conditions that will be applied to all agricultural fields in the simulation.
 
 S4
 Step S4 presents a summary of the configuration and requires confirmation to proceed.
 
 S5
 Step S5 concludes the process of creating a new setting by sending it to the simulation server.
info:
# Italiano --- # SCancel Lo step **SCancel** serve per annullare il processo di creazione di un nuovo settaggio. # S0 Lo step **S0** serve per chiedere all'utente se desidera iniziare un nuovo settaggio. # S1 Lo step **S1** consente di specificare il numero di campi agricoli, compreso tra 1 e 6. # S2 Lo step **S2** permette di indicare quali sensori sono presenti in ciascun campo agricolo. Questo step viene iterato fino a ricevere il comando **S2 OK** o **S2 ALL**. # S2 OK e S2 ALL Gli step **S2 OK** e **S2 ALL** servono per confermare la selezione dei sensori per il campo agricolo corrente. # S3 Lo step **S3** consente di definire le condizioni climatiche di partenza che saranno applicate a tutti i campi agricoli nella simulazione. # S4 Lo step **S4** presenta un riepilogo della configurazione e richiede conferma per procedere. # S5 Lo step **S5** conclude il processo di creazione di un nuovo settaggio, inviandolo al server di simulazione.


# English --- # SCancel The **SCancel** step is used to cancel the process of creating a new setting. # S0 The **S0** step is used to ask the user if they wish to start a new setting. # S1 Step **S1** is for specifying the number of farm fields, between 1 and 6. # S2 Step **S2** allows the user to indicate which sensors are present in each agricultural field. This step is iterated until the **S2 OK** or **S2 ALL** command is received. # S2 OK and S2 ALL Steps **S2 OK** and **S2 ALL** are used to confirm the selection of sensors for the current agricultural field. # S3 Step **S3** is used to define the starting climatic conditions that will be applied to all agricultural fields in the simulation. # S4 Step **S4** presents a summary of the configuration and requires confirmation to proceed. # S5 Step **S5** concludes the process of creating a new setting by sending it to the simulation server.

Garbage Collector
Read InfluxDB humidity
query:
from(bucket: "SA-FMS")
  |> range(start: -5s)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "smart_agriculture_measurements")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["field_id"] == "field2" or r["field_id"] == "field1")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sensor_type"] == "humidity" or r["sensor_type"] == "temperature")
  |> yield(name: "last")
